image.altText: A man in Army fatigues holding a kelpie

props.synopsis: Defence force dogs have been side-by-side with troops for decades, including when a rescued kelpie started saving diggers' lives after the Bombing of Darwin. Now they're finally getting their due.

title.children: Dogs of war recognised for decades of lifesaving service

image.altText: Drone view of housing rooftops and roads

props.synopsis: An increase in government assistance, better relationships between tenants and landlords and bolstered housing stocks are just some of the solutions Australia's leading housing experts have offered to solve the country's rental crisis.

title.children: Australia's leading minds propose their solutions to the rental problem

image.altText: A blue, white and red 'bulk billing available' sign on a black fenceline

props.synopsis: Federal Labor and the Coalition both want to expand the bulk-billing incentive to all Australians, to make nine out of 10 GP visits free by the end of the decade.

title.children: Will a new bulk billing pledge mean you'll see your GP for free?

image.altText: Seredau Tariyaljan and Banula Marika wear traditional clothing and stand on a beach in the Northern Territory

props.synopsis: For generations, both the Yolŋu people from Australia's Northern Territory and Indigenous groups from Taiwan have maintained ancient cultures despite colonisation, with the shared experiences of the groups in focus as part of a new cross-cultural performance.

title.children: Taiwan and Australia share a history you might not know about

image.altText: A close-up shot of an young Aboriginal teenage boy.

props.synopsis: Many children in Australia with fetal alcohol spectrum disorder — or FASD — won't be diagnosed until they are involved in the criminal justice system. But with the right supports, kids can thrive.

title.children: Scotty has FASD. He worries other kids are falling through the cracks

image.altText: A western brown snake coiled up on dirt.

props.synopsis: Central Australia's snakes are on the move after a drop in temperature and recent rain, with an Alice Springs snake catcher warning residents that numbers could boom after a dry and brutal summer.

title.children: Alice Springs on alert as break in extreme heat rouses deadly snakes

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman raises her arms in the air.

props.synopsis: The 17-year-old from Western Australia has fought incredible odds of distance and disability to bring her debut album to the national stage.

title.children: Rising First Nations artist Iconyx's tribute to music icons

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy at a press conference speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian president's comments come days after the US publicly declared it was not realistic for Ukraine to join the military bloc, which Russian President Vladimir Putin is strongly opposed to.

title.children: Zelenskyy says he's willing to resign to get Ukraine into NATO

image.altText: A man wearing an akubra hat speaks at a press conference in front of an outback building

props.synopsis: Barnaby Joyce has likened Labor's attempt to drag the Coalition to a fight on health care as government crying that they've seen the "Loch Ness monster". Follow live.

title.children: Barnaby Joyce likens Labor's Medicare campaign to the 'Loch Ness monster'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: PM says there's 'more work to do' as 'crunch point' nears
Chinese warships carrying 'extremely capable' weapons with range of 540 nautical miles
Butler denies Labor froze the Medicare rebate

image.altText: A security guard stands with his back to the camera in front of an emergency department entrance

props.synopsis: Long waits in overcrowded emergency departments are leaving patients frustrated and exacerbating violence towards staff, according to the peak body for emergency medicine.

title.children: Doctors say violence in emergency departments a 'national crisis'

image.altText: A partially bald man wearing glasses and a suit smiles

props.synopsis: Centre-right party the Christian Democratic Union of Germany is projected to win the national election, putting Friedrich Merz on track to be the country's next chancellor.

title.children: German conservatives claim election win, Merz poised to be new chancellor

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Richard White stands in front of office windows, with rooftops and trees visible behind him

props.synopsis: Shares in WiseTech Global have plunged on news four board directors, including the chair, have quit due to a dispute about the ongoing role of founder, billionaire Richard White.

title.children: WiseTech shares plunge as directors, chair quit over Richard White

image.altText: Blurred numbers on the ASX stock boards

props.synopsis: The ASX follows Wall Street's lead lower as concerns mount about the US economy. WiseTech shares fall as turmoil continues as directors quit the board. Follow live.

title.children: ASX falls after Wall Street's worst session of the year

image.altText: Tom Sermanni speaks to Matildas players after losing to the US

props.synopsis: Michelle Heyman's header was ultimately in vain as the Matildas fell to a 2-1 loss against the United States in Arizona.

title.children: Late Heyman goal not enough as Matildas fall to second straight loss

image.altText: A young man in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: A young man was discharged from a Gold Coast hospital despite his mother warning he was suicidal. When he died days later, a review of his case fused anger to his mother's grief.

title.children: Mother says review of son's death blamed him

image.altText: A NSW Marine Rescue boat on the water.

props.synopsis: The NSW Game Fishing Association says reports a man who fell overboard during a competition near Newcastle yesterday was attacked by a shark are incorrect, as an air and sea search for him resumes.

title.children: Game fishers say Sydney man pulled into water by shark was not attacked

image.altText: The picture of two men wearing tradition Islamic headwear and robes shown on a screen in a stadium with a crowd surrounding it

props.synopsis: Hassan Nasrallah was killed in an Israeli air strike in September 2024, and Israel continued attacks on Lebanon in the hours ahead of his funeral despite a ceasefire deal in place.

title.children: Thousands mourn slain Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah in funeral

image.altText: Woman in white dress holding photograph of a little boy and a little girl

props.synopsis: A mother from the West Australian town of Bunbury shares her horrific experience of losing a child, who unknowingly had a heart condition, in hope of helping others in grief.

title.children: Grieving mum does not want people to be afraid to say her son's name

image.altText: A red brick school building with manicured lawns and gardens.

props.synopsis: Ballarat Grammar School's principal alleges older students have been hitting their younger peers in "some sort of perverse sense of justice for perceived boarding house misdemeanours".

title.children: Senior boarders accused of striking young peers at prestigious school

image.altText: Pope Francis sitting on a white chair during a service.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis remains in a critical condition after suffering a respiratory crisis.

title.children: Pope Francis remains in critical condition, Vatican says

image.altText: Millie Bobby Brown wears her hair pulled back and a peach slip dress as she walks a red carpet

props.synopsis: The red carpet has been rolled out and the stars are arriving for the 2025 SAG Awards. See what everyone is wearing here.

title.children: What the stars are wearing at the SAG Awards

image.altText: Rachel Yang in a coworking space in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Data shows just 2 per cent of total capital raised in Australia in 2024 went to all-female founded teams in 2024. Some of Australia's leading entrepreneurs and investors think Australia should ignore Donald Trump and instead follow California's lead to make diversity reporting mandatory.

title.children: Trump wants to end diversity quotas. Investors say Australia needs more

image.altText: Cows in a barn being milked.

props.synopsis: An ongoing avian influenza outbreak in the US shows no signs of abating, as thousands of staff at the nation's leading health and science agencies have been let go.

title.children: Concerns over US bird flu outbreak as health agencies face cuts

image.altText: An overhead shot of white vehicles with red crosses lining a street as people surround them

props.synopsis: Israel called off the release of more than 600 Palestinians from jail on Saturday in protest over the displays in Gaza.

title.children: Hamas rejects Israeli claim hostage handover ceremonies are humiliating and degrading

image.altText: Virat Kohli holds his bat and helmet aloft after reaching an ODI century for India

props.synopsis: Virat Kohli guides India to a six-wicket Champions Trophy victory over Pakistan in Dubai, setting a new individual record in the process.

title.children: Kohli sets new record as India beats Pakistan in Champions Trophy

image.altText: Biomechanics expert Rene Ferdinands working with a bowler. A cricket ball is in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Rene Ferdinands's research helped establish the 15-degree rule that decides whether a bowler's action is legal, but he says the process for finding potentially illegal actions needs to change.

title.children: Biomechanics expert wants more scrutiny on suspect bowling actions

image.altText: A teenaged girl wearing a broad brimmed hat smiling and standing in front of a group of sheep.

props.synopsis: When the 19-year-old's phone fell from her ute tray while she was checking water troughs in far west New South Wales, it triggered a region-wide emergency response.

title.children: Smartphone mishap triggers big outback crash 'emergency'

image.altText: Charlotte Caslick makes a run for the Wallaroos

props.synopsis: Australia's women cop a 34-10 semifinal drubbing from top-ranked New Zealand at the Rugby SVNS tournament in Canada.

title.children: Wallaroos thumped by New Zealand in Vancouver sevens semifinal

image.altText: Australian soldiers with a kangaroo at a camp near the pyramids.

props.synopsis: Kangaroos, a kookaburra and even a Tasmanian devil were smuggled overseas by Aussie soldiers during World War I, not just as pets but as symbols of home.

title.children: Australian soldiers brought outback animals to the frontline in WWI

image.altText: A racing greyhound highlighted mid-race.

props.synopsis: Animal welfare activists are concerned the "true breadth of racing-related deaths" in the greyhound industry are unknown.

title.children: This was Supreme Caesar's final race before it died, earning $0 for its owner

image.altText: Police tape.

props.synopsis: A 47-year-old man has died and another is due to face court on a murder charge after an incident at a home in northern New South Wales.

title.children: Murder charge for man who fell from roof during standoff with police

image.altText: satellite weather image

props.synopsis: The weather system is sitting about 910 kilometres north-east of Cairns and is forecast to reach category three by Tuesday.

title.children: Cyclone Alfred forms off Queensland coast

image.altText: A man in a hat shooting a gun

props.synopsis: Liberal candidate Thomas Brough implies he is part of a group of doctors who will ensure WA gun owners are not negatively impacted by new mental health checks.

title.children: Liberal candidate says 'posse' of GPs won't hang gun owners out to dry

image.altText: A woman smiling for the camera while leaning on a desk

props.synopsis: Experts say most employers are open to considering job-share roles but there are a few things employees can do to help get it over the line.

title.children: Job-share roles were 'unheard of' when Kylie asked her boss for one
